Detailed Description

Masterclass for all types of media.

The motherclass for all media.
It keeps track of the operations allowed for the files in use.
So the routine,that ueses a mediafile, can check if the operation is supported for the current file.
All the variables are capsulated, so the only way to get values, is over getter-functions.
This will hopefully make improving the code much easier, because the API will not change at all, when improving code.
You always must call issupported() after constructor, because this sets the filetype.
Without setting of the filetype, nothing will be done on the file.

Returns:

const bool mediafile::ismodified (  )  const

This method checks if the object was modified.

Returns:
TRUE if something in the tags has changed, FALSE if the tags are same as on fileopen

const bool mediafile::issupportedfile (  ) 

Method for checking if the file is readable by our application.

This Method checks, if the file is readable by our application.
It also checks out, which format the file has, and sets filetype internal.
For the Moment only fileformat::Mp3 and fileformat::Ogg are supported.

Returns:
TRUE if the file is valid, FALSE if file has not readable format, or does not exist.

const bool mediafile::readtags ( int  version = tagversion::v2tag  ) 

This method reads the tags of the object.

If issupportedfile() was not called before this method is called, it does this itself, to get the filetype , and to see, if the file exists;
The reading itself is delegated to the taglibinterface, since all reading is done using taglib.
If version is not set, Mp3s will always load v2tags, if they exist.
Set tagversion::tagtype to choose what tags are preffered. If not set v2tags are the ones that are used.

Returns:
TRUE if file could be read, no matter if there where tags inside
FALSE if file doesnt exist or file has an unsupported format

const bool mediafile::savetags ( int  version = tagversion::v1tag|tagversion::v2tag  ) 

This method saves the tags of the object.

call ismodified() if you want to know if the file needs saving

Parameters:
version version with the tagversion. If version is not set V1- and V2tags will be set.
Version is ignored on Ogg-Files.
Returns:
TRUE if file could be saved,
FALSE if file doesnt exist or file was not modified

bool mediafile::setpicture ( const QImage &  image,
const Coverart::pt  picturetype 
)

Set an Image, if it is possible for the filtype.

Returns:
TRUE if the image was set, FALSE if the filtype doesnt support images
